Facebook & share our pinned post
YouTube
  We have been developing Antraxx for over 5 years now—at least since the initial concepts. When we first began we were far too naive (and ambitious) to achieve what we wanted to achieve. We have spent a lot of money over the years on art assets, server hosting and feeding ourselves all from our savings - but we can’t continue that way. We’ve built up a great fanbase, a loyal following and we know this is a game that people want.
To fully realise this dream we need financial support. We’ve had talks with multiple publishers, but we don’t really want to go down that route. We want this project to be an ever evolving world. Antraxx is not just one game, its a universe, a franchise and hopefully a legacy.
SPECIAL THANKS TO
While working on Antraxx we've had the chance to meet a lot of amazing people on our way to work with, and would like to take this opportunity to introduce them to you.
INDIGO 2016 - Antraxx premiered at INDIGO, the showcase for the finest, most outstanding games by independent developers. The games range from brand new playable prototypes to completed games offering impressive and rich experiences. We took this experience to gather feedback and to stress test the client and server.
  Kongregate is a great webbrowser gaming website that is part of the gamestop network. Kong is supporting us by giving away Kong+ to backers of Antraxx with a special pledge pack of €40,-. The original value of Kong+ alone is $29.99 A YEAR!
Kong Plus gets you more out of your Kongregate experience. Take advantage of ad-free gaming, cool profile skins, automatic beta access, and private chat with Kong Plus. Learn more on the Kongregate website
Although we are currently not working together with MANA on the marketing for Antraxx and the promotion of our Kickstarter campaign we would like to thank Mana Marketing for a huge role in building our player base and getting the word out. We wouldn't have been able to be where we are today without them. A true recommendation to other indie game developers also. Check them out here.
        DEVELOPMENT
We began prototyping Antraxx a few years ago under the old name “META4”, that had to change due to legal reasons. We initially used Actionscript with FlashDevelop in a custom 2D engine that ran on mobile devices, the web and desktop using Adobe Air. This worked well for our initial prototype and it helped us see many flaws in the game. 
Last year we decided to re-write the game and redo some of the initial concepts, no more point and click and more action. We are now utilising some of the latest technologies, such as WebGL and ES6. The engine is written to be scalable, networked and run on many platforms from the ground up. So far we support: Web, Windows, Mac, Linux and Android devices (tablets/mobiles) running Chrome. A mobile/tablet version of the game has been one of our goals since the project’s inception. With your help we may be able to achieve this through stretch goals. It will require a lot more time and testing on physical devices, therefore more money but the technology is there already.
    The game engine can be ran headless as a server or graphically as a client, which supports a full 3d environment (we use sprites and clever uv mapping tricks to achieve the isometric pixel art style), positional audio, lighting, dynamic shadows and much more that you’d expect to find in modern games - all running in the browser. Antraxx runs entirely on custom proprietary software with support from libraries such as socket.io and THREE.js, there is no game engine such as Unity used.
We tweet more than daily @AntraxxGame - follow us to keep up with our development.
    You may be wondering why it takes so much time and costs so much to create a mech, well let's break it down. A mech is composed of 8 individual components which have to be drawn separately in 16 angles (besides the legs which use 8, however their animation is the most complex). We need to ensure that each of these components is able to fit onto other mech models and still look good. Once the initial angles are drawn, certain pieces need animating. Let's count the frames:
- Legs: 8 angles, 10 frames of animation = 80
- Cockpit: 16 angles, 2 frames of animation = 32
- Shoulder: 16 angles, 2 frames of animation = 32
- Weapon (left): 16 angles, 6 frames of animation = 96
- Weapon (right): 16 angles, 6 frames of animation = 96
- Side weapon (left): 16 angles, 6 frames of animation = 96
- Side weapon (right): 16 angles, 6 frames of animation = 96
Total: 528 individual frames per mech
    GLOBAL BUDGET BREAKDOWN
Of the aimed 30,000 euros (roughly 33,000 dollars), we will dedicate 29% to both artwork and continued development of the game, as well as initial server upkeep at launch. From our projected estimates we will be spending around 400 euros a month initially to run two regions of game servers (Europe and US). If we go over our goal we will be able to allot more funds to the servers which opens up more regions (such as Asia, Africa). The game engine has already been developed to a point where it is ready to fully flesh out the game world.
If we reach our stretch goals we can get friends who are very good pixel artists to help rapidly create art pieces that we can plug into the game. This includes but is not limited to: map construction kits, mech pieces, promotional artwork and in-game ui. Most of our rewards are digital or physical art pieces, which is why it is included in this tier. Our physical mech model is also included in this cut, we have a deal arranged with the manufacturer to produce as many as we require after Kickstarter is completed at a low rate due to the 3D model and prototype already being completed several months ago.
You may be wondering, why are we only aiming for 30k as an initial goal? Well, we have already invested over 35,000 euros into the project (near $40,000) over the course of development, with costs ranging from artwork to promotional material and server upkeep. Unfortunately, we have spent what we can afford to spend on the game without your support to help get it to completion.
Kickstarter and taxes take quite a large chunk, about 31% in total which leaves only 11% to audio for sound effects and music. We already have a large collection of in-game SFX, and we plan to produce a Noisia-ish style with heavy drum and bass influences combined with the old original starcraft OST. Leendert has 10 years experience in audio production, he has spent the majority of his time managing artists, producing art and promoting the game - but with your funding he cant wait to get his hands on more of the audio aspects of Antraxx and produce a full OST.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Developing any type of game is a huge undertaking and challenge, especially a multiplayer one. However, with over 10 years experience in programming, game development and networking, the technical issues, for the most part, have been overcome. We have had a demo available online on the browser which was connected to our server, providing a constant online world for a few months. It had a few issues to begin with but were smoothly ironed out and many optimizations were possible thanks to our dedicated fanbase that help us with testing and load balancing. So far we’ve had over 1,500 individual players in the game and hope for many more as the game progresses. We’ve had overwhelmingly positive feedback on how the game performs, how it plays and how it looks. After years of fine tuning, we finally have a solid direction.

There are still issues to face, however. The primary issue for us would be server upkeep, mainly because of the costs involved for the amount of players we want. This is one reason Kickstarter is a great idea, as it allows us to definitely have the funds there to be able to run the servers we require.

In terms of gameplay, it won’t be an easy road to balance the game and ensure its compelling and accessible to new and experienced players alike. This is something that only comes with extensive testing and user feedback. As our fans know, we frequent on our social channels requesting feedback and working with players to implement the ideas that they have or to resolve issues. To help solve this issue, we will run in early access for a few months before the game’s launch to perfect gameplay as much as possible.

Regardless of issues we will face, here is what we can promise:
We engage directly with the community and listen to feedback, and will continue to do so while we develop this game and maintain it. This isn’t a game where we release it and then never touch it again—we want it to be an ever evolving universe.
We'll have full transparency in regards to the development process, delays and issues we face.

We’ve come this far. Now we just need your help to fully realise our's (and many of our fans') dream game. Thank you for your support.

Hey everyone!
Just wanted to say a huge thankyou to our 73 backers (as of writing this post) in supporting us, helping us steadily but surely reach our goal. We have just flown through 3,000 euros which is 10% of our initial goal. We can do this!
To celebrate, we're hosting another live stream RIGHT NOW at: https://www.twitch.tv/antraxxgame
We're streaming the map creator currently and explaining how we create maps, the amount of art that goes into it and other never before seen things.

Hello dear backers!
First off all: welcome to all new backers - thank you so much for your support!
In approximately 2 hours we are doing a live stream to show our game demo and conquerable map system.

Hey there!
It has been 3 days since we launched our Kickstarter campaign and we have an exciting new demo update to announce. Introducing: ZONE CLAIMING

campaign.story:
We are shipping the game from within the United States, European Union, and Australia. Additionally, thanks to unlocked stretch goals, all supporters receive $10 off the listed shipping estimates! Please see the FAQ for more information.
GURPS (the Generic Universal RolePlaying System) turns 30 this year, and Dungeon Fantasy focuses its award-winning power on hack ‘n’ slash fantasy roleplaying, where stalwart heroes kick down doors, kill monsters, and take their stuff in order to grow powerful enough to tackle the next quest . . . which naturally features stronger doors, tougher monsters, and better stuff! 
All images shown are work in progress and not 100% final.
This standalone boxed set contains everything you need to play: cardboard figures, combat maps, dice, and five full-color rulebooks that feature original art.
Adventurers (128 pages). GURPS is famous for letting you play any character you can imagine. Dungeon Fantasy keeps this flexibility while trimming away unnecessary details, concentrating on just what matters to monster-slaying, treasure-hunting action: Pick from 11 classic professions and nine playable races, customize your alter-ego using quick-start templates and a powerful point-build system, and gear up with an equipment list that offers dozens of weapons and lets you assemble exactly the suit of armor that fits your image.
Exploits (112 pages). Learn how the heroes actually use their abilities and gear. That means combat, of course – and dozens of other activities, whether your thing is sneaking around, swinging from the scenery, exorcizing evil, or getting rich through cunning deals in town. This book also describes countless bad things that can befall adventurers (poison, traps, dismemberment, lava pits . . .), as well as good things, namely loot. And it’s full of practical advice to the Game Master who leads this three-ring circus: challenging the players, keeping the action moving, settling arguments, and much more.
Spells (80 pages). What would fantasy be without magic? Adventurers features four spellcasting professions (bard, cleric, druid, and wizard), and this volume describes over 400 spells to help you customize them. It also includes complete rules for how spells work – whether their power comes from the gods, Nature, or creepy tomes of forbidden wizardly knowledge.
Monsters (64 pages). Once the adventurers are ready, and armed with weapons and magic, it’s time to test their mettle! This catalog starts you out with more than 80 things that want to bite, claw, grab, sting, and curse the heroes – not just the predictable orcs and zombies, but also several Dungeon Fantasy originals. Each offers notes on tactics and variants, and the whole collection comes with advice and rules for adventurers dealing with monsters . . . and monsters dealing with adventurers.
Dungeon (24 pages). I Smell a Rat is a simple (but not simplistic!) quest designed to show new gamers the ropes. Like any classic hack ‘n’ slash adventure, it starts at the inn. From there, the heroes will find themselves facing traps, enemies, and unexpected twists – and finding treasure, although not necessarily gold and silver. Advice and “adventure hooks” let the Game Master challenge advanced players or spin the tale into a series of adventures.
While based on the GURPS Basic Set and its GURPS Dungeon Fantasy and GURPS Magic supplements, this is a standalone roleplaying game, ready to play out of the box! It’s compatible with GURPS, but the famously detailed rules have been streamlined to be friendlier to new gamers and veterans alike. For existing GURPS fans, revisions made in response to nearly 10 years of customer feedback on the GURPS Dungeon Fantasy series – along with completely new content unique to this set – make this a “must have.”
Check out these stretch goals!
IMPORTANT NOTE: All stretch goals listed below are only eligible to backers pledging $50 or more. Pledges of $49 or less do not receive any of the listed stretch goals.
In addition to your pledges, every dollar spent on GURPS and Pyramid Magazine goodies on Warehouse 23 during September 2016 counts toward the Kickstarter stretch goals. See the graph below. 
SEPTEMBER 27 UPDATE: So that we can keep delivery of the game on schedule, $225,000 is the final stretch goal. 
To add these Dungeon Fantasy items to your game, simply include the listed cost as part of your pledge. After the project closes, we will send a survey through BackerKit where you'll tell us exactly which of the following you want.
Dungeon Fantasy GM Screen: The Dungeon Fantasy Roleplaying Game is designed to run quickly. This full-color, four-panel screen will place important tables and modifiers at your fingertips to speed up game play even more. Includes two 16-page booklets – one to accelerate character creation and advancement, the other providing ready-to-play characters for a really speedy first game! • $20 + shipping to be charged separately through BackerKit.
Dungeon Fantasy Roleplaying Game: One copy of the Dungeon Fantasy Roleplaying Game printed box set. • $50 + shipping to be charged separately through BackerKit.
Dungeon Fantasy Roleplaying Game in PDF: One copy each of the five books in the Dungeon Fantasy Roleplaying Game in PDF delivered through Warehouse 23 when the game ships in 2017. • $35
Dungeon Fantasy GM Screen in PDF: The screen panels and booklets in PDF delivered through Warehouse 23 when the physical screen ships in 2017. • $5
12 Custom Dungeon Fantasy Bases: Extras of the custom 1-inch hex-shaped bases that are included in the Dungeon Fantasy Roleplaying Game box. • $6 + shipping to be charged separately through BackerKit. One set automatically included in the I Want It All!!! reward level.
12 Custom Dungeon Fantasy Bases (Rainbow): Two each of six different colors (red, orange, blue, green, yellow, and purple) of custom 1-inch hex-shaped bases. • $6 + shipping to be charged separately through BackerKit. One set automatically included in the I Want It All!!! reward level.
How to Be a GURPS GM: Simple, practical guide to using GURPS to run a fun game, with ample quotes from GURPS developer and mastermind Sean “Dr. Kromm” Punch. Most of this advice is equally useful to gamers starting with the Dungeon Fantasy Roleplaying Game. • $20 + shipping to be charged separately through BackerKit.
How to Be a GURPS GM in PDF: The book content in PDF delivered through Warehouse 23 at the same time as the other already-existing PDFs (listed below). • $11
Dungeon Fantasy Companion: A single printed volume containing the content of all the stretch goal PDFs unlocked at the end of the campaign – but at a minimum, Dungeon 2, Magic Items, and Traps. Everyone pledging at the $250 level and above will get this! Everybody else can buy it as an add-on. • $20 + shipping to be charged separately through BackerKit.
Eye-In-The-Pyramid Dice: Six extra eye-in-the-pyramid dice. • $5 + shipping to be charged separately through BackerKit.
Dungeon Fantasy started life as a series of PDF supplements for GURPS. We are offering all of these existing PDFs as add-ons. Except for Pyramid: The Dungeon Fantasy Collection and future issues of Pyramid subscriptions, they will be delivered to backers after the campaign ends via Warehouse 23, the one-stop online shop for all your Steve Jackson Games needs.
All of these PDFs assume the reader has the GURPS Basic Set and usually GURPS Magic; most refer to earlier supplements in the series. With a little effort, however, you can use any of them with the Dungeon Fantasy RPG. 
These items are especially easy to add to Dungeon Fantasy RPG games, with little reference to other supplements, or lots of material that can be used as-is. Expand your gaming possibilities early!
GURPS Dungeon Fantasy 6: 40 Artifacts • Catalog of unusually powerful magical weapons, armor, and accessories. • $6
GURPS Dungeon Fantasy 8: Treasure Tables • Every kind of treasure imaginable, from the mundane to the incredible, with an option to generate hoards randomly. • $11
GURPS Dungeon Fantasy 10: Taverns • Four ready-to-use taverns with maps, along with the innkeeper profession and rules for tavern-related tasks and treasures. • $8
GURPS Dungeon Fantasy 17: Guilds • Guide to companies, families, noble courts, secret societies, and other organizations heroes can petition for aid or even join. • $8
GURPS Dungeon Fantasy Monsters 3: Born of Myth & Magic • Sixteen legendary dangers and magical threats, plus more monster modifications. • $6
GURPS Dungeon Fantasy Treasures 1: Glittering Prizes • Guide to interesting coins, wondrous fabrics, unusual materials, and strange treasure origins. • $6
GURPS Dungeon Fantasy Treasures 2: Epic Treasures • Yet more amazing items for heroes to find. • $5
GURPS Dungeon Fantasy Adventure 1: Mirror of the Fire Demon • The heroes must race rivals across wilderness and dungeon to find an amazing artifact before it’s too late. • $10
These items all contain lots of extra material you can use in a Dungeon Fantasy RPG game, but exploiting them will require more effort; they may refer to abilities or rules that aren't in the boxed set, draw upon other supplements in the series, etc.
GURPS Dungeon Fantasy Denizens: Barbarians • Options, variants, gear, and abilities for everyone’s favorite warriors of the wild. • $8
GURPS Dungeon Fantasy 18: Power Items • Additional rules and options for power items. • $5
GURPS Dungeon Fantasy 16: Wilderness Adventures • Gear and abilities for the great outdoors, along with expanded rules and advice for wilderness quests. • $10
GURPS Dungeon Fantasy 15: Henchmen • Professions intended for sidekicks and hired help – or for the heroes of a low-powered campaign. • $8
GURPS Dungeon Fantasy 14: Psi • Mentalist profession and its psionic abilities, as well as psi-themed monsters, hazards, and gear. • $10
GURPS Dungeon Fantasy 13: Loadouts • Ready-to-print equipment lists for every profession up to this point in the series. • $10
GURPS Dungeon Fantasy 12: Ninja • Ninja and assassin professions, their abilities, and their special weapons and equipment. • $5
GURPS Dungeon Fantasy 11: Power-Ups • New abilities for every profession and race up to this point in the series. • $8
GURPS Dungeon Fantasy 9: Summoners • Demonologist, elementalist, necromancer, and shaman professions, plus servitors to summon and notes on the places they’re summoned from. • $8
GURPS Dungeon Fantasy 7: Clerics • Rules for matching the abilities of clerics and holy warriors to the gods they serve, plus special gear for holy folk. • $8
GURPS Dungeon Fantasy 5: Allies • Supernatural pets, servitors, and familiars for spellcasters. • $8
GURPS Dungeon Fantasy 4: Sages • Artificer and scholar professions, along with rules for arcane writings. • $5
GURPS Dungeon Fantasy 3: The Next Level • Nonhuman races, mixed professions, and new abilities. • $8
GURPS Dungeon Fantasy 19: Incantation Magic  • A new flexible magic system and the incanter profession which uses it. • $8
GURPS Locations: Hellsgate • A bit of Hell on Earth – useful both as a mapped-out town for delvers to visit and as a setting for urban adventures. • $8
GURPS Locations: The Tower of Octavius • This luxuriously mapped, ready-to-use wizard’s tower is suitable as a dungeon, stronghold, or location in town. • $8
GURPS Magical Styles: Dungeon Magic • Describes seven distinct wizard subtypes, each with its own colorful magic. Requires GURPS Thaumatology: Magical Styles to use to the fullest. • $8
GURPS Powers: Divine Favor • Alternative system of clerical magic, used in several articles in the content listed under Pyramid Magazine. (Refers to GURPS Powers, but you don’t need that to use this item!). • $5
GURPS Thaumatology: Magical Styles • Wizards need not be all the same! Learn how to differentiate them by their training. (Refers to GURPS Magic and GURPS Thaumatology, but you don’t need them to use this item!) • $8
These items are mostly redundant if you're getting the Dungeon Fantasy boxed set. They're recommended only for completists and tinkerers who need to see what assumptions were made for the rest of the series.
GURPS Dungeon Fantasy 1: Adventurers • Templates, abilities, and gear for heroes. • $8
GURPS Dungeon Fantasy 2: Dungeons • Rules for adventuring tasks in town and the dungeon, plus advice to the GM on designing dungeons and handing out loot. • $8
GURPS Dungeon Fantasy Monsters 1 • Thirty monsters with tactics and plot ideas, plus options for modifying any kind of monster. • $10
GURPS Dungeon Fantasy Monsters 2: Icky Goo • Slimes, molds, oozes, fungi, and other things to make you go “Ew!” • $6
Pyramid magazine presents new material for GURPS each month. You can add on subscriptions, a special compilation, and whole issues that have been devoted to GURPS Dungeon Fantasy. Much of this material will require extra effort to use with the Dungeon Fantasy RPG, drawing on the GURPS Basic Set and possibly other GURPS supplements – even those outside of the GURPS Dungeon Fantasy line.
Pyramid subscriptions • Cutting-edge GURPS support, features, and articles, downloadable every month! Each issue is a new theme . . . but watch for an upcoming "Stretch Goal" for why a Pyramid subscription might become extra useful. • Three-month subscription: $20 • Six-month subscription: $40 • Twelve-month subscription: $70
Pyramid: The Dungeon Fantasy Collection • This compilation collects Pyramid articles of particular interest to Dungeon Fantasy gamers, which have appeared outside of the Dungeon Fantasy- and Alternate Dungeons-themed issues (below). It includes over 20 articles taken from issues 10, 13, 19, 25, 38, 43, 47, 48, 56, 58, 61, 64, 68, 70, 75, 77, 78, 80, and 82. This is a direct compilation, without updates or changes. Scheduled for release in December 2016. • $15
Pyramid #3/36: Dungeon Fantasy • New professions, advice, and power-ups. • $8

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The greatest risk of all is completing the artwork, layout, and manufacturing of the game. The text for the box set is 100% complete, and artwork and layout have started, but there are always opportunities for things to go sideways during a creative project.

None of the stretch goal PDFs have been written yet, because whether we even get to do them depends on you! However, we've produced high-quality PDFs every month for years, and we feel confident in our ability to deliver on our stretch-goal promises in a timely manner.

We believe we have taken all of the steps necessary to bring the game to completion and ship on schedule. Our last Kickstarter project -- Car Wars Arenas in 2015 -- delivered on schedule, and we think this game will also ship on time. As always, we will update backers throughout the entire process and deliver as close to on time as possible.

updates.update_userinfo: Dungeon Fantasy Magic Items 2 Now On Kickstarter, Monsters 2 In Austin
updates.update_content:
Two bits of important news for fans of the Dungeon Fantasy Roleplaying Game.
Sean Punch and the team have finished work on Dungeon Fantasy Magic Items 2, a companion to the Magic Items portion of the Dungeon Fantasy Companion. This new book presents a collection of rare – often unique – artifacts for adventurers to loot from chests, pry from dead hands, earn as rewards, or even buy (if they’re wealthy enough). Why? Because you can never have enough treasure! And it is now funding on Kickstarter!
Dungeon Fantasy Monsters 2 arrived in an Austin warehouse last week and is on track to mail out to project backers this month. For those of you who missed out on the Monsters 2 campaign earlier this year, we have a reward level in the project that offers both books.

The project has met its goal and, along with the support of The Citadel at Norðvorn campaign, demonstrated that there are still fans of the GURPS game who want to see us produce printed books. Our future decisions will be impacted by the funding success of this current project, so please join in Dungeon Fantasy Monsters 2 today and help us to judge the level of demand for print books.
Werewolf Adventure Seeds

updates.update_userinfo: Troll Adventure Seeds and New Stretch Goals!
updates.update_content:
This week, the Dungeon Fantasy Monsters 2 campaign comes to a close and we continue work to finalize the new book -- as well as the reprint of the Dungeon Fantasy Roleplaying Game box set -- so that we can ship the project to the factory. And now that we've met our goal -- and the sister campaign, The Citadel at Norðvorn, has met its goal -- we're happy to announce two new stretch goals that are directly related to the success of Douglas Cole's The Citadel at Norðvorn project!
If The Citadel at Norðvorn reaches $16,000 in funding before it comes to a close, we will replace the  dice that are packed inside the box with six silver pearlized acrylic 14mm d6. And if hits $18,000 before that campaign ends, we will pack one 3.5-inch by 5.5-inch pocket journal (featuring artwork) inside the box set.

More monsters also means that this index of creatures will need an update if it is to keep up. What is this? Forum user Rasputin has created and posted an index of monsters from various and titles, giving everyone a fantastic reference for planning adventures and encounters. Awesome work!

campaign.story:
Past the Last Mountain is four-issue geopolitical fantasy comic about Kate the faun, Willa the dragon, and Simon the young troll boy, who find themselves on the run from the United States Government. You can read the first issue for free right now by going to www.paulallor.com/ptlm.
The original mini-series is completely done, and ran on Comixology earlier this year, published by Comics Experience. With your help, we are very excited to collect it in print!
Written by Paul Allor (Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles), with art and colors by Louie Joyce (Mishmash) over layouts by Gannon Beck (Space Corps), Past the Last Mountain is an exciting and emotional adventure story about the importance of hope and the power of kindness in an unkind world.
In addition to the original Past the Last Mountain mini-series, the book includes Orc Girl, a one-shot fantasy comic with art by Thomas Boatwright. Set in the same universe as Past the Last Mountain, Orc Girl is a sweet coming-of-age story that acclaimed comics writer Gail Simone called “funny, charming, bittersweet and moving; a perfect little comic, realized brilliantly.”
But that's not all! Along with Past the Last Mountain and Orc Girl, the book features twenty short comics drawn by twenty different artists, all set in the Past the Last Mountain universe. Basically, it's a mini-series, a one-shot and an anthology, all in one incredible book.
Past the Last Mountain artists and colorists include:
Aaron Houston (Oxymoron)
Anderson Cabral (Drones)
Arielle Jovellanos (Fresh Romance)
Ashley A. Woods (NIOBE: She is Life)
Bailey Patchett  
Becky Jewell (Tilted Sun)
Brittany Peer (TMNT: Casey and April)
Caspar Wijngaard (Limbo)
Chris Evenhuis (Wynonna Earp)
Eoin Marron (Red Cube Studio)
Eric Zawadzki (The Dregs)
JD Faith (Virgil)
Jeffrey Veregge (Red Wolf)
Joe Lalich (Batman 80-Page Giant)
Joe Mulvey (Scam)
Jordan Gibson (Howard the Duck) 
Juan Romera (Strange Nation)
Jules Rivera (Gutter Magic)
Marissa Louise (Robocop)
Paul Tucker (Tet)
Rebecca Nalty (Red Cube Studio)
Rebekah Isaacs (Buffy the Vampire Slayer)
Silvio dB (The Locksmith)
Sjan Weijers
Triona Farrell (Weavers)
In addition to the book, everyone who pledges at the print level or higher receives this awesome print by series co-creator Louie Joyce.  
For a bit more, you'll also receive these amazing prints from contemporary watercolor painter Jody Edwards, who shows us how fantasy creatures might be painted if they were just an ordinary part of our everyday lives. And let's be honest -- these would look amazing on your wall.
For those who prefer to wear their art, we have two T-shirt designs available. The logo of the Westfield Penal Preserve, where these creatures live until their big escape; and a look at Simon the Troll Boy preparing for battle. 
These high-quality, silk-screened T-shirts are comfortable as heck, and are perfect for any situation, from a backyard barbecue to a comic convention to your cousin’s wedding. 
 We also have many other awesome rewards, including a digital book that contains the script for every issue and short story; a script critique by me; and original art by Louie Joyce, including a variant cover for your own comics project. 
You can learn more about each of these rewards on the right. And if you would like to customize a reward or discuss add-ons, please don't hesitate to reach out.
As you can tell, Louie and I are very proud of Past the Last Mountain, and we’re certain you’ll love it as much as we do. To support this incredible book, please look through the rewards and make your pledge now. Then, share this campaign with your friends, family and enemies over social media. Thank you for helping us make this awesome book a reality.
The first issue is available in its entirety at www.paulallor.com/ptlm, and the first eight pages are available below. We will also add pages from the PTLM shorts, throughout the campaign.
  Paul Allor is a comic book writer, letterer and editor based in North-Central Indiana. He has worked on properties ranging from Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles to Guardians of the Galaxy to Bravest Warriors, as well as critically-acclaimed creator-owned books such as Tet, Past the Last Mountain and Strange Nation. He also writes Imagine a Chair, a weekly column on the craft of writing comics. You can reach him at paul@govtcomics.com, or follow him on Twitter @PaulAllor.
Louie Joyce is an Australian illustrator and comics creator. His illustration work has been exhibited internationally and his comics include The Many Harold Holts of Space & Time, Little Red, Astral and self published books MISHMASH & HODGEPODGE. His short comic The Corner Store was nominated for a 2014 Ledger Award and won the Ace Comics & Games 2013 Best Short Australian Comic prize. You can see more of his work at louiejoyce.com, get in touch with him at louiejoyce.art@gmail.com or follow him on Twitter @LouieJoyce.

campaign.story:
Scout, the last scientist, returns to her ancestral home of Earth to find it in a state of wilderness. A story about the value of science & skepticism, and their conflict with religion and narrative-based thinking. After the Gold Rush is a return to optimistic Science Fiction - the idea that the world can be better. 
This Kickstarter aims to print the second chapter in the saga. Each issue is 22 pages long, with extra features such as web comic pages, a scientist of the issue section, write-in science corrections, etc. 
We ran a Kickstarter last year to start After the Gold Rush, and thanks to all of our awesome backers we have enough to keep the story going for 4 issues! However, the plan was to keep them digital. Due to popular demand we are planning to print them now. And that is why we are back on Kickstarter. 
See the cover for ATGR #2 close up.
    This image will also be the logo on the T-Shirts!
It is good to have warnings, but it is better to have goals. Science Fiction is full of important stories warning us about the dangers of our hubris. That is a useful lesson, but it shouldn't be all we use the genre for. I grew up watching Star Trek, a show about exploration, progress, and ethics. While it didn't always nail the details, it cared about science and reason. After the Gold Rush is my small attempt to return some of those ideas to modern Science-Fiction.
   This comic is also about the value of skepticism, and explaining what that means. Too often skeptics are synonymous with cynics. I want to show what skepticism is really about - caring about what's true. 
If you want to know more, check out the episode of Skeptics Guide to the Universe I was on. I go over my aspirations for the book in more depth. 
  Isaac La Russa & Miles Greb
Miles Greb - Creator & Writer - Former Bob Dylan impersonator whose obsession with Star Trek is annoying to everyone.
Isaac La Russa - Lead Artist & Concept Artist -Based in Illinois, he wears motley flannels and owns two ungrateful cats.
Adrian Geller - Colorist - Like Mario Paint for the SNES, but with nearly twice the personality
Andrew Pierce - Editor - Lovable goof. Escaped Kipling protagonist.
Jamie Me - Lettering - Letterer who spends his time wearing pajamas called a 'gi' while learning the art of Brazilian jiu-jitsu.
Barry Blankenship -Cover Artist & Logo Design - Amateur cursing cat ventriloquist.
Lauren Uhde - Science Adviser - PhD student and all-around Biology Babe.
Ben Rodgers - Assistant Editor - Historian of historical biographies, at least he was historically. 
 Poster Team - David Hovey ,Natasha Alterici, Chris Lewis Lee. 
 You can follow the project closer at - @Goldrushcomic. 
 Some of the characters and technology you will find in After the Gold Rush. I have some more concept art to show from things to come in future issues - see the stretch goals for more details! 
Scout, the last scientist.

    Scout and her chemical synthesizer.

   Of course we have the comic book itself, and some beautiful prints. But first, I wanted you to take a moment and check out this amazing work by Milsae Kim.
 This print will be available as an 11" X 17", but it will also be part of a limited run of variant covers for After the Gold Rush #2. There will only be 100 printed. This is your best chance to get one. They will all be signed by Miles Greb.
If you didn't get a printed copy of #1 yet...
In case you missed out last time. :)
 New Reward! 48 hours special, a one of a kind sketch cover. 
This reward, the Luna Level, features this one of a kind cover, the variant cover, and a signed copy of ATGR #1. 
The Reward Levels
A Look at the Art Pints
All the prints are 11" x 17" except for "Inspire Science", that is 8 1/2"x11". They are all printed on a high quality glossy card stock, and look great. If you back at a reward level with a large art print, you may choose whatever one you fancy. Here are your options. 
Shirts
They are print on demand, so sizes S to XL are available!!
By popular demand we have included After the Gold Rush T-shirts as reward options! Wear this to show your science-loving comic support around town, and wherever cool comic-people hangout. The T-shirts are print on demand, so sizes should not be an issue. I think they look pretty cool. 
Custom Profile Art, by Isaac La Russa
Want to see yourself in a Cyro suit or a Titan Explorer uniform? There are reward tiers with both a full body commission like the one you see below. or, you can get a profile done that is perfect to use for facebook or twitter. The art will be delivered to you digitally.

Full body art commissions by Aimee Zhou
We also have the amazing storyboard artist Aimee Zhou on staff. The $125 dollar reward level includes a hand drawn commission of you in a Titan Explorer or Cyro suit! And the original art will be delivered to you! Pretty cool. 
Aimee will draw you in a ATGR suit, and you get the actual copy!
 Stretch Goals
If things go really well I would love to be able to continue the ATGR webcomic. It precedes the events of ATGR, and follows Scout as a young girl growing up on Titan. You can check it out here for FREE.
    As some of you know, we ran a Kickstarter last summer to get the whole story started. Thanks to everyone's support we have the funds needed to finish all the art for ATGR #2. We had planned to release it digitally only, not printed. 
    However, demand for a printed copy has been really high, so here is your chance to make it a reality. Most of the budget will go directly into Printing Costs and Shipping. Another small chunk will go into art fees for commissions done especially for this Kickstarter - the variant cover and some new art commissions. Lastly, fees from Kickstarter, taxes, stuff like that.

SPECIAL NOTE:
OrganATTACK! has reached multiple stretch goals that will apply to ALL rewards starting with the 2nd ($20) reward tier!* Every full boxed game will now come with an expansion pack, a die-cut sticker, upgraded finishes on the boxes, AND a free set of Awkward Yeti themed poker cards. Whether you pledged on day one or you pledge on the last day you will receive these! If you are getting 3 full games, you also get 3 sets of stretch goal rewards!
*the only tier not eligible for stretch goal rewards is the first ($16) tier, which was created exclusively for the purpose of reducing shipping cost to international backers.
OrganATTACK! brings to life medical and pseudoscientific concepts in a twisted, hilarious, very fun, and surprisingly educational card game for anyone who owns organs.*

Developed, designed and illustrated by The Awkward Yeti, creator of four successful Kickstarter campaigns,* including this one to make Heart and Brain plush toys. Awkward Yeti comics reach millions each month on the web, including a portion of 1.2 million Facebook fans. (*100% of The Awkward Yeti's campaigns have reached or exceeded their goals!)
A beta test was held with about 30 participants to help refine the game
  Gallbladder's Last Day
The Awkward Yeti is the New York Times best selling cartoonist behind Heart and Brain, as well as the cartoonist behind Lars on LINE Webtoon, Medical Tales Retold on Tapastic, and a variety of viral comics. A great deal of care was applied to the development of the game over the past year - making sure there was a good balance between randomness and strategy, that the medical themes are often informative but requires absolutely no medical understanding, and that the representations of characters were true to the comics.
I've been wanting to make a board game for much longer than that, but could never quite figure out the details. With card games seemingly making a comeback (or at least with me becoming aware of this comeback last year) I started thinking of ways I could simplify my mindset. One day I went for a run, accidentally forgetting my headphones at home, forcing me to use my brain for entertainment. That's when I came up with the initial concept for the card game in its entirety. All during one run. Since then of course I spent countless hours developing and re-developing that concept, and that's where we are now...
About the Game
The object of the game is to remove your opponents' organs using corresponding afflictions before they remove yours. The last person to still have at least one organ is the winner.
In addition to Affliction cards (like Pancreatitis, which can be played on either Gallbladder or Pancreas), the game has instant defensive cards, and lots of crazy tactical moves that shake things up. What you end up with is a pretty fast-paced, very fun, and often intense gameplay that's suitable for all levels of players.
The game is best enjoyed by 2-5 players.

ORGAN DECK (20 cards):
There are 19 organs in the deck, plus one Organ WILD card. The 19 organs were chosen based on the most used Awkward Yeti characters, and include most of the major organs like Heart and Brain, as well as fan favorites like Tongue and Teeth. 
Organs require 2 afflictions for removal and the Organ WILD requires 4 afflictions for removal (however, it is susceptible to any affliction card)
ATTACK DECK (72 cards):
Afflictions: It takes two corresponding afflictions to remove an opponent's organ. Afflictions match up with one or more organs and can only be played on that organ (unless you play it along with Metastasis, which turns an Affliction into a Wild)
Wilds: Wilds can be played as one affliction on any organ, except for Necrosis Wild cards, which instantly remove an organ
Resistance: Defensive cards that resist attacks or instantly block attacks
Tactical and Bureaucracy: These cards shake the game up in a variety of ways. For example, "Kidnapped" allows you to take an opponent's organ for yourself. "Sedate" skips an opponent for two turns, etc
Poisoned: As soon as the card is drawn, the player must remove one of his/her own organs.
The two decks will be packaged side by side in a nice box along with the rule book (I will update as I have more specific info/design available)
Hyperthyroidism
About the Kickstarter
Some specifics are subject to change
The Awkward Yeti has successfully completed multiple Kickstarter campaigns to raise money for new projects, including this campaign for Heart and Brain plush toys. Without these campaigns, major product launches simply would not be possible. It's one of the best ways to show support for a webcomic cartoonist!
The game has been in development for about a year and has been through multiple revisions and a full beta test, so it should be ready for production within a few weeks of the Kickstarter's end (pending any improvements).
The goal was set to be the minimum amount I believe will be needed for production of the game, shipping to backers, and Kickstarter and credit card fees. I am prepared to cover additional fees myself if necessary. Of course, there's great hope that it will go well beyond the goal!
Note: Backers are charged AFTER the Kickstarter ends, ONLY IF the original goal is met.
The game should be produced and shipped out to backers before the winter holidays, so keep it in mind as a gift!
SHIPPING RATES: These have been calculated based on the lowest USPS rates available to us after their recent price increases. These were calculated based on estimated weights, which will exceed the low weight threshold of 13oz. Higher tiers have been given discounted shipping due to the amount pledged.
Goals:
The more money we raise, the lower the price per game will be, and that means room for bonuses! Here's what Kickstarter backers can expect at each level (goals in color have been reached):

  Enjoy your stickers!

  The gift will be a set of customized Poker cards! All backers at a $20 tier or higher will receive this at no extra charge! NICE!
  $100,000 in under 12 hours, whoa!
  These will be delivered via backer-only update
  An expanded expansion pack? Mind: blown
    THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!
The Awkward Yeti's work shows up in millions of newsfeeds every month through his website and social media.
Learn more about The Awkward Yeti at theawkwardyeti.com, facebook.com/awkwardyeti, twitter.com/theawkwardyeti, instagram.com/theawkwardyeti, on wikipedia, and many other social media sites!

*OrganATTACK! includes mildly-morbid themes that may not be suitable for those sensitive about medical conditions. OrganATTACK! is meant to be taken lightly as a pseudoscientific joke. Recommended for ages 12+

I have produced many different products and have a lot of experience with printing in general. Because of this, I have a good advantage in getting things done properly and efficiently, and I'm also aware of many potential issues.

campaign.story:
What's this all about?
I’m an illustrator & cartoonist who’s always loved a good story. My story is about Scout, a family dog who gets lost in the woods, runs into a lonesome bigfoot, and how they work together to survive all kinds of deadly hazards and emotional peril. The comic was just an experiment at first, but it caught on, and people liked it. And I’ve never had more fun working on anything.
Who's it for?
Untold Tales of Bigfoot is great for comic fans of any age. There's no swearing, no nudity – just good clean fun, adventure, a little mystery and a lot of heart.
What are we all doing here?
If we reach our goal, this Kickstarter will get Untold Tales of Bigfoot into print and into your hands.
What else can I get?
Besides the book (printed & pdf versions) we'll have digital wallpaper, bookmarks, stickers, button sets, one-of-a-kind commissioned artwork – even some fun options for putting you right there in the woods with Bigfoot and Scout!
Reward Tiers
If you just want the book, you can get just the book. But If you want to stack custom art and other fun rewards on top of that, I've got you covered. Here's a quick breakdown:
Sometimes it's easier to visualize what you're getting with actual images. So here are some featured reward tiers.
The Scout Tier ($26) is your basic, printed book tier. You get the book, the bookmark, and the digital assets.
The Sleeping Bears Two-Pack ($46) is for anyone who needs a second book for collecting, or gift-giving, or whatever.
 The Naturalist Tier ($55) is a great value that offers a lotta' bang for your buck and includes a custom cartoon illustration of you deep in the woods with Bigfoot and Scout.(NOTE: If you're caricature-shy, you could have your friend, spouse or child take your place in the woods next to Bigfoot. No problem! And a great gift idea!)
The Cave Drawings Tier ($100) Gives you everything from The Naturalist Tier PLUS you can get me to draw any single character you want (no nudity) and I'll hand ink it, color it with grey marker, sign it and ship it out with your book. Imagine the possibilities!
The Sweet Baby Corn Tier ($350, limited to 4 people) puts you right in the action as a character in a 6-page Untold Tales of Bigfoot short that'll run online. You'll also get a special Kickstarter Edition Comic Book of the printed story.
Stretch Goals!
$9,000 Book Upgrade! If we reach $9,000, everybody who bought a physical copy of the book gets an upgrade to a more elaborate, deluxe version of the book! That includes a more substantial cover, an introduction by award-winning author Matthew Cody (whose books are fantastic fun for middle-grade to adult readers -- check 'em out), and an afterword by me discussing the origins of this comic.
$10,000 Patch! If we reach $10,000, everybody who bought a physical copy of the book gets a 3-inch, fully-embroidered Friend of Bigfoot Patch to show the world that you and Bigfoot are good buddies!
 Want to add an extra copy of the book?
I've had a few requests about add-ons from folks who'd like a second copy of the book for collecting, gift-giving and even donating to their school library (way to go!). Kickstarter doesn't make it easy, but the prevailing method seems to be clicking the “Manage” button and adding the price of a book to your pledge. In this case, if you've pledged to get a physical book already ($24 and above), an extra, signed copy of Untold Tales of Bigfoot is just another $20. Here's how to do it:
I ask you to remind me twice that you added an extra book because I want to make sure I get your order correct. I'm nutty that way.
Note to International Buyers: Adding one (1) extra copy of the book to your bundle ($24 or higher) won't raise your shipping, thank goodness. Message me if you'll need more than one extra. Also, I know the international shipping rates are high and there's not much I can do about that. But, to try to ease the pain just a little, any international backers who pledge for a physical copy of the book get this free sticker.
What's this now? Samples and blurbs?
I didn't want to give too much of the story away to those who aren't familiar with it, but here are some sample pages from the book and some very nice things a few very talented folks had to say about Untold Tales of Bigfoot.
        Where's all the money going?
Most of the funds contributed go toward printing the book, having it shipped to me, and then mailing it out to you. Another smaller percentage goes toward art and shipping supplies, and some of the smaller rewards. The final chunk of change is handed over to Kickstarter/Stripe for their fees.
And I'll be using PrintNinja for the books because they've done a fantastic job with many of the Kickstarter Graphic Novels I've backed.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Book One is done. Art and story. So that's a load off. But, having backed a few Kickstarters myself, I'm aware that even with great preparation, sometimes a monkey-wrench is tossed into the gears (production issues, illness, backers dropping out, etc.). But if we get the books shipped to us in a timely manner, I'll begin signing/sketching in them as soon as they're in hand. And I hope to start any commissioned pieces as soon as I can collect the information from the buyers. That, too, takes time but literally all I do all day is draw, so I'm used to that. So it's really just a matter of getting the art done and sending it out. And, while all these variables prevent me from pinning down an exact date, overall, I feel confident that, as long as we get the money to print this book, I can fulfill the rewards as promised in a timely manner. 

For those who choose “The Naturalist” tier, I'll send out your physical rewards as soon as I'm done signing/drawing in your books. The digital file of you with Bigfoot & Scout will be finished as soon as possible and emailed separately.

If anyone chooses the “Sweet Baby Corn” reward tier, they'll receive the bulk of their rewards as soon as I'm done signing/drawing in the books. The digital file of you with Bigfoot & Scout will take some time and will be emailed separately. But the 6-page short will take longer. I'll be drawing that and posting it as quickly as I can, but that'll take longer to accomplish than the single Bigfoot/Scout image. The story is outlined, but receiving your photos, doing character studies, and drawing your characters in multiple panels will take a while. I don't have an exact date set for when the 6-pager will post, but I'll send out updates along the way to keep you apprised and after it's had it's run online I will have the pages printed and bound and ship that special Kickstarter Edition comic to you separately.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Untold Tales of Bigfoot Nominated for another Reuben
updates.update_content:
Apologies to anyone who’s had to hear this news a dozen times so far this year, but I just realized I hadn’t posted it here, in Kickstarter, where some of my biggest supporters connect with me.
It might seem like deja vu from a year ago, but Untold Tales of Bigfoot was once again nominated for a Reuben from the National Cartoonists Society in the category of Online Comics - Longform. This is our fourth nomination, and Bigfoot, Scout, and I are honored to be considered again.
The awards banquet happens in Huntington Beach, CA on May 18th at NCSFest this year, just a couple weeks away. I won’t be attending, but if I happen to squeak by with a win, I’ll make sure to post the results here. And, if I don’t happen to score the prize, just know that I’m very happy to be nominated by the NCS and that I consider this further proof that Kickstarter Backers know quality when they see it. : )  Thanks, folks! -v

campaign.story:
Sidekick Quests: The Secret of the Sewer Wizard is James Stowe's very first Kickstarter and the first time Sidekick Quests the webcomic has been collected in a print Graphic Novel. With your help this Kickstarter will create a 96 page book that collects the first comic storyline, The Secret of the Sewer Wizard, and also provides game rules allowing you to play out Secret of the Sewer Wizard as a roleplaying game campaign adventure. The print version of the Secret of the Sewer Wizard has revised artwork throughout with updated colors, dialog and text. There will also be 10 bonus pages of never before seen comics that show what happens after the original adventure ended. The book will also serve as Sidekick Quests the Roleplaying Game’s very first adventure module. The adventure consists of three quests and two encounters that can be played together as one complete story or separately as stand alone games sessions. Anyone that backs the PDF or print versions of the book also get a digital bundle of all the Sidekick Quests rules, quests, characters and advancements that have released online already. that have released online already.
    A breakdown of the adventure contents are as follows:
Clean out the Dungeon Quest asks PCs to help a down on his luck Master of Dungeons named Carl perform some Spring cleaning of a castle basement that is full of monsters and maybe even haunted. Includes: rules on running the quest, 1 quest handout, 1 Ghost NPC sheet, 1 Dust Bunnies NPC sheet, 1 Vacuum Monsters NPC sheet, and an illustrated Map of the Dungeon
The Homunculus Encounter introduces the mysterious Homunculus, servant of the Sewer Wizard. What will happen when PCs meet this foul little creature? Includes: rules on running the encounter, 1 Homunculus NPC sheet
The Search the Sewers Quest finds the PCs deep underground, trapped by the terrifying, but generally understood Sewer Wizard. Can they recover their missing doorknocker without being turned into bunnies? Includes: rules on running the quest, 1 quest handout, 1 Sewer Wizard NPC sheet, 1 Sewer Rat NPC sheet, and a fully illustrated Map of the Sewer 
The Professor Pendarva Encounter brings a full fledged adventurer to the rescue. But is this Professor friend... or foe? Includes: rules on running the quest, 1 Professor Pendarva NPC sheet
The Escape to the Surface Quest follows the action of the new 10 page comic and follows the action that happens after original comic ended. Can the PCs make it back to Fairevale? Only if they make it past pirates, trolls and a giant octopus! Includes: rules on running the quest, 1 quest handout, 1 Zombie Pirate NPC sheet, 1 Cave Troll NPC sheet, 1 Giant Octopus NPC sheet, and a fully illustrated Map of the Caverns Below Fairevale.
Now I want to make sure that everyone understands The Secret of the Sewer Wizard is just an Adventure for the already available Print and Play Sidekick Quests the Roleplaying Game but... that is okay even if you don't known a copy of the game already. Why? Because if you get a copy of The Secret of the Sewer Wizard (digital or physical) you also get everything that has ever been released for Sidekick Quests the RPG in the Digital Bundle. Now I bet you are asking yourself...
   Sidekick Quests is an all ages webcomic that follows children in a fantasy world and the trouble they get into when their adult mentors go off adventuring and live them home alone. Not only is Sidekick Quests a comic, it is also a roleplaying game designed to introduce kids how to play roleplaying games. Sidekick Quests the comic has been available digitally for four straight years. It has seven complete storylines and releases three times a week.
The Secret of the Sewer Wizard was the very first story, released back in 2012. In it four sidekicks, a squire, an apprentice, a scout and an amateur jester discover the existence of a monstrous wizard dwelling in the sewers underneath the dungeon they use as a clubhouse. The secret he holds about the history of their kingdom change their lives forever. The cast includes:
      Sidekick Quests the Roleplaying Game is designed to be played by kids and adults. Children as young as 6 can play squires, scouts, wizard apprentices, jesters in training and even the Game Master. It is a simple system that can be used as an introduction to more complex roleplaying games or can be played as a rules lite alternative for adults looking for something different, colorful and above all...fun. Up until now everything you needed to play Sidekick Quests the RPG has been available online in easy to download print and play PDFs. Anyone that backs the PDF or print versions of the book also get a digital bundle of all the Sidekick Quests rules, quests, characters and advancements that have released online already. By backing the Secret of the Sewer Wizard you will get everything you will need to play this campaign and more. Like comics, the Secret of the Sewer Wizard has pages upon pages of all ages appropriate story to discover. Like games, the Secret of the Sewer Wizard tells a complete multi-session roleplaying game adventure that can be played by the whole family.
    The Secret of the Sewer Wizard has several ways to unlock stretch goals, adding content to the PDF bundle that comes with every award level above $1 and adding physical improvements to physical rewards. 
By following Sidekick Quests on Twitter (twitter.com/SidekickQuests) Character Rewards are unlocked in the form of new equipment and magical artifact action cards that any role can use as well as new equipment and artifact rules added to the Sidekick Quests the Roleplaying Game rules included in the PDF Bundle. More Character Reward Stretch Goals will be announced once all the existing goals are achieved.
By following Sidekick Quests on Facebook (facebook.com/SidekickQuests) In Game Encounters are unlocked in the form of new npcs and monsters that can be used in encounters as well as new expanded encounter rules added to the Sidekick Quests the Roleplaying Game rules included in the PDF Bundle. More In-Game Encounters Stretch Goals will be announced once all the existing goals are achieved.
By sharing a link to the Sidekick Quests Kickstarter using the hashtag #skqks Rules Additions are unlocked in the form of new options, character advancements, and even a digital coloring book added to the existing PDF Bundle. More Rules Additions Stretch Goals will be announced once all the existing goals are achieved.
By reaching beyond the funding goal Book Upgrades are unlocked.
 Keep track of the progress toward unlocking stretch goals on the chart below. With your help we can make the Secret of the Sewer Wizard the best product it can be.
  You can add funds for these as part of your Kickstarter pledge, or you can add funds later when you complete the fulfillment survey in order to get more stuff! And who doesn't like more stuff?
  Anyone who backs both Sidekick Quests: the Secret of the Sewer Wizard and Knuckle Sammich - Kobolds Ate My Card Game for a product reward tier ($10+ backers of The Secret of the Sewer Wizard and $19+ backers of Knuckle Sammich) will receive one special one of the kind add-on to each game! As a backer of the Secret of the Sewer Wizard you will get character sheet files so that you can actually play Ninth Level Games iconic orange furred Kobolds as Player Characters in the Sidekick Quests the Roleplaying Game. As a backer of Knuckle Sammich you will receive an ALTERNATE KING TORG (All hail King Torg!) card (featuring art by me) which will provide a slightly different experience when playing Knuckle Sammich! Only people who back both projects get these add-ons! So if you are already are backing Sidekick Quests then head over to https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/9thlevel/knuckle-sammich-kobolds-ate-my-card-game and check out Ninth Level Games' Knuckle Sammich - Kobolds Ate My Card Game. Get extra rewards just for being a generous fan of fun, quality games.

Anyone who backs both the Secret of the Sewer Wizard and Untold Tales of Bigfoot Kickstarter campaigns for a physical book reward tier (25+ backs of The Secret of the Sewer Wizard and $24+ backers of Untold Tales of Bigfoot) will receive one special print with each book (Vince Dorse will be including a Sidekick Quests print along with copies of his book and I will be providing a UTOB print along with mine)! Only people who back both projects get these two incredibly rare free prints (confirmation required). So if you are already are backing Sidekick Quests then head over to https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/vincedorse/untold-tales-of-bigfoot-graphic-novel and check out Vince Dorse's Untold Tales of Bigfoot. Now you can get extra rewards just for being a generous fan of quality comics.
 I've been involved in the roleplaying game industry for most of my career. I run my own freelance illustration company, James Stowe Illustration. Four years ago I started an online comic project called Sidekick Quests that combined my experience with roleplaying games with my love of illustration in a project that I could share with my kids and ideally other geeky parents could share with their kids.
Initially I created a simplified version of 4th Ed. DnD for my then 6 year old son’s birthday party. I had been toying around with some long form comic ideas and once people really started responding to the work I did for that party I decided to expand upon it.
And now here we are. I really want Sidekick Quests to be a living roleplaying game. I find the idea of a comic that can be played as an ever changing and expanding roleplaying game setting is something I’ve always wanted to play. And if it is also a way to introduce a new generation to tabletop RPGs, all the better. It was from the ideas and solutions I worked into those initial sheets that I developed Sidekick Quests, both as a comic and as a stand alone roleplaying game for kids. Two of the characters from the sheets (the ranger and the bard, see above) actually converted directly into characters in the comic (those being Benton the Scout and Dalea the Amateur Minstrel respectively. I have always enjoyed world building, so taking those sheets and creating an entire world around them was one of my favorite parts of the process. I have pages and pages of notes and thumbnail sketches about the World of Adventur (the setting of Sidekick Quests) and its denizens and lore.
  Sidekick Quests is one of the great joys of the internet. Part roleplaying game, part web comic, it's unique, and delightful. Kids and parents alike will love James Stowe's lively, wonderful creation - as my daughter and I already do.
John Kovalic - innovator of fantasy roleplaying comics since 1997, creator of Dorktower and Munchkin artist extraordinaire!
(James Stowe’s) world and characters captures imaginations in young and old alike. Sidekick Quests is doing a huge part to seed the next generation of tabletop gamers with positive messages and healthy table habits that encourage inclusiveness and fair play. You cannot go wrong laying down your hard-earned dollars on this campaign.
Brian Patterson - creator of d20Monkey  
(Sidekick Quests the Roleplaying Game) feels like the best game of DND you played as a twelve year old indoor kid, in all the best ways.
Chris O’Neil - Kobolds Ate My Baby and 9th Level Games  
Sidekick Quests is engaging, dynamic, and everything that a kid's RPG should be. It's got old-school charm, indie sensibilities, and is just plain fun.
Tracy Barnett - Exploding Rogue Studios
James took what could've been a one-off internet meme and turned it into an earnest love letter to fantasy adventure.
Daniel Solis - Creator of more fantastic indy tabletop games than you can shake a Kodama branch at.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is James Stowe's very first Kickstarter. While the updated comic and script for the adventure are complete the 10 bonus pages, art prints, and maps still need to be created and the adventure copy needs to be edited and laid out.Every publishing project carries risks. Sidekick Quests is created, illustrated, written, game developed and directed by one guy, James Stowe (with some amazing assistance from his editor/internet guru Anna Izenman and writing/playtesting help from his family) If James were to be struck my lightning or choke on a ham sandwich, it would have a big impact on the completion of this project than a larger company might see. Sidekick Quests uses outside suppliers and shippers for printing and manufacturing, which involves possible risks and delays there James can’t foresee or control.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

The Future is Now is an art book, a document that the Robo-President K3n3-DY has ordered everybody must have. It's a compendium of the present future which will provide all the knowledge about Robo-City 16 and its dwellers. You will also explore exotic places outside the Robotic Union of Europe, like The Nation of the Sands, Harajuku Walled Island or the Independent States of Scrapland. 
The most recent model is the Volume Two, which is currently in development, but will be conveniently delivered to you upon completion. You will be able to acquire Volume One too, and rewards according to your level of dedication to the City.

Almost half of the funds will go to the production of the books and the extras. A big print run will be produced with the maximum quality possible. The rest will cover the shipping, the fees for the Ministry of Kickstarting and our mighty Corporate Payment Overlords, and general Taxes from the Robotic Union.
The content will be finished and sealed with the stamp of approval from the Robo-President by the end of August. The production will be done in early September, followed by a quality check on every book and extras, and the packaging phase. 
By the first of October the shipping phase will begin, and by the end of the month all the proud Robo-Citizen will have their packages.
Thank you for your cooperation.
Long live the Robo-President! Glory to the Machine!

campaign.story:
Retrofit Comics is raising money to publish our next 12 graphic novels and comic books!
We All Wish For Deadly Force by Leela Corman
Hellbound Lifestyle by Kaeleigh Forsyth and Alabaster Pizzo
Elf Cat in Love by James Kochalka
Summerland by Paloma Dawkins
Libby's Dad by Eleanor Davis
Our Mother by Luke Howard
I Thought You Hated Me by MariNaomi
Canopy by Karine Bernadou
Lovers in the Garden by Anya Davidson
Shit and Piss by Tyler Landry
a currently untitled story by Sophie Yanow
Babybel Wax Bodysuit by Eric Kostiuk Williams
We've published 45 comics and graphic novels since we were founded in 2011 by New York Times bestselling cartoonist Box Brown. We actually started with a successful Kickstarter, and have been aiming to publish around 12 comics a year ever since.
So why another Kickstarter?
We want to make sure the printed quality of our comics stays as high as possible to match the vision of all of our artists, but we also want to be able to pay our artists more upfront! Creating comics is a slow and difficult process, so more money in advance helps the artists instead of waiting to be paid after their comic has been selling for a long time.

What comics are you going to publish?
We've got a lot of artists we are super excited about! We'll publish 6 in the spring and 6 in the fall.
 We All Wish For Deadly Force by Leela Corman
72 color pages, 6x8.5 inches (140x152 mm), perfect bound softcover graphic novel
We All Wish For Deadly Force is a collection of Leela's short stories.
Leela Corman is an illustrator, cartoonist, and Middle Eastern dancer who lives in Gainesville, Florida, with her husband Tom Hart and their daughter, Molly Rose. Her works include Flimflam, Queen’s Day (Alternative Books), Subway Series (Alternative Books), and Unterzakhn (Schocken/Pantheon).
Hellbound Lifestyle by Kaeleigh Forsyth and Alabaster Pizzo
76 color pages, 5x7.25 inches (127x184 mm), perfect bound softcover graphic novel
Hellbound Lifestyle is a book of Kaeleigh Forsyth‘s private notes and journals, illustrated by Alabaster Pizzo.
Alabaster went to the School of Visual Arts and lives in Queens, New York. She work includes Wool and Gin and Mimi and the Wolves (Hic and Hoc).
Kaeleigh met Alabaster when they both discovered they had been dating the same person for a year. They've been best friends ever since.
Elf Cat in Love by James Kochalka
100 black&white pages, 5.5x8.5 inches (140x216 mm), our first HARDCOVER graphic novel!
When the incredibly conceited Elf Cat goes on a quest for the Ice Sword with his magical friend Tennis Ball, they will face dragons, magical hot dogs, snowflake princesses, and confront their feelings! If you find love in many places, can you see it when it is right in front of you?
James Kochalka is the first Cartoonist Laureate of Vermont and lives in Burlington, Vermont. His works include Monkey vs Robot, SuperF*ckers, the Johnny Boo and Dragon Puncher series for children, and his 14-year span of daily diary comics American Elf. He also releases music as James Kochalka Superstar.
Summerland by Paloma Dawkins
48 color pages, 7x10 inches (178x254 mm), perfect bound softcover graphic novel
Summerland is the story of Santana and her cousin Gwen who work on a play with Chucho while all three are vacationing in Summerland.
Paloma Dawkins animates and makes comics in the icy deserts of Canada. Her work includes art for the National Film Board of Canada, Epic Meal Time, Paul Galvin, Booya Videos, Deadmau5 and Imogen Heap.
Libby's Dad by Eleanor Davis
40 color pages, 7x8.5 inches (178x216 mm), saddle-stitched stapled comic book
Eleanor Davis is a cartoonist and illustrator who lives in Athens, Georgia. Her works include How To Be Happy (Fantagraphics Books), Stinky (Toon Books), and The Secret Science Alliance and the Copycat Crook (Bloomsbury) and Flop to the Top (Toon Books), both of which she created with her husband Drew Weing.
Our Mother by Luke Howard
32 spot color pages, 7x9.5 inches (178x241 mm), saddle-stitched stapled comic book
Our Mother is a comedy about growing up with a parent who has an anxiety order. 
Luke Howard received a MFA in comics from The Center for Cartoon Studies, where he now teaches. He lives in Vermont. His work includes Trevor and All Coons Look Alike to Me: The Life of Ernest Hogan, Father of Ragtime. His other new comic Talk Dirty to Me will be published by AdHouse in May!
The 6 comics for the fall are still being finished by the artists, so those will come out throughout the fall as they are finished but should all be finished by December!
When are these coming out?
We will be printing and shipping 2 comics together, to get printing discounts and to save you shipping when they get mailed out! Plus this way you get lots of cool comics in the mail!
Schedule:
April 2016: We All Wish For Deadly Force & Hellbound
May 2016: Elf Cat in Love & Summerland
June 2016: Libby's Dad & Our Mother
The last 6 will come out in the fall in sets of 2 as soon as they are finished by the artists!
Where is the money going?
Our two main costs are printing and the artist advances. We also included an extra 5% for the Kickstarter fees, extra 5% for credit card processing fees, and extra 10% overhead (for unexpected costs or emergencies.)
Your video is great! Who made it for you?
The uber-talented artist John Kinhart!
Videos: https://vimeo.com/johnkinhart
Comics: http://www.sorrycomics.com/
Keep an eye out for his upcoming comic book documentary!
Anything else?
Thanks for all your support! We (and Retrofit Comics) really appreciate it.
- Box & Jared

campaign.story:
Penny Powers–superpowered defender of truth and justice, with the ability to pulverize menacing monsters or vile villains with her patented Power Punch, and who, disguised as mild-mannered honor roll student Penelope Powski, passionately defends the proud people of Plainsburg and all citizens of planet Earth!
Inspired by the classic comics and heroes we all grew up with, Penny Powers vs the Maniacal Meatloaf Monster features fun wordplay and dialogue, fantastic fantasy characters and scenarios, and enough excitement to make kids (and adults) want to read it over and over again!
Media Inquiries: CDowd.com@gmail.com
Who is Penny Powers?
PENNY POWERS is the superpowered alter ego of fourth grader Penelope Powski. No one knows Penelope's secret except for her superpowered sidekick, and cat, Pepper. Together, these two heroes protect their school and their neighborhood from the forces of evil as PENNY POWERS and HYPER-CAT!

What's This Book About? 
In this, Penny Powers' first adventure, a classmate bites into a mysteriously malignant meatloaf and morphs into the Maniacal Meatloaf Monster! When Penny learns that the malicious meat man is immune to her ferocious fisticuffs, she must use her brain instead of her brawn to save the day!
Have a look at these uncolored work in progress pages (final pages will be fully colored).
 Who is This Book For?
Penny Powers vs the Maniacal Meatloaf Monster is perfect for young readers aged 5-9 who love fun, silly superhero adventure stories like Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, Adventure Time, or Powerpuff Girls.
Where's the Money Going?
If successful, this campaign will allow Penny Powers vs the Maniacal Meatloaf Monster to be published as a full color, 32 page premium softcover children's book featuring a positive, heroic female lead, an anti-bullying theme, a flying cat, and a monster made of meat! Funds raised will go towards printing, shipping, packing materials, taxes, fees and other very boring but necessary expenses.
And as if that weren't enough...
Help give a book to a kid who needs one. Just add $10 to any pledge to donate a book to the Maryland Book Bank, a nonprofit organization committed to cultivating literacy in children from low income families.
But wait - there's more!
Add any of the above items to your physical reward simply by adding the appropriate amount to your pledge:
Donated copy of Penny Powers: $5
The A to Z Guide to Jobs for Girls Board Book: $13
The A to Z Guide to Jobs for Girls Soft Cover: $6
Lilith Dark and the Beastie Tree: $15
Penny Powers vs the Maniacal Meatloaf Monster: $7
4" x 4" Penny Powers+Girls Rule Sticker Set: $10
Penny Powers will be printed by Print Ninja.
This project doesn't exist without your support. Thank you all! -Charlie
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I've been independently creating and publishing since 2010, and have successfully completed and fulfilled multiple Kickstarter campaigns since then. I am fully aware of what I've gotten myself into, and am confident that this campaign will go just as smoothly as my previous campaigns.

Still with experience, problems can arise. This can run the gamut of production issues, illness or personal injury, natural disasters, etc. If any of these things do occur, I will do everything in my power to keep you all informed via publically posted Kickstarter updates.

I'm using a trusted and known printer, Print Ninja. While their reputation is great, even they can face issues like random customs inspections, weather events, or even a labor strike, any of which could potentially cause delays in fulfillment.

With my experience and the experience of my trusted printing partner, I'm sure that no matter what issues may arise, we'll find a way to get this great book in your hands.

Anyone with a print order of $30 and above will receive all 4 prints below.
Welcome!
Hey and welcome to the Kickstarter for HUMANESCENT, Volume 1! HUMANESCENT is a full-color, 50+ page, collection of short comic stories, written by me, Jacques Nyemb, and Illustrated by several talented artists (learn more about them below).  
All artwork for HUMANESCENT is completed, and the book will be fully laid out before this Kickstarter is over.
I can't wait for you to see it! 
The Book:
This book has seven stories, with diverse art styles and topics. Here's a taste of what you can expect.  
Tribal Quest
A village sends two people to explore the "edge" of their world. The adventure increasingly perilous, reveals a world so beautiful, yet dangerous. 
Art: Skuds Mckinley
Colors: Justin Wood
Letters: Michael Neno
Monolith 
Despite how much a community may change, there are always pillars keeping its soul alive.
Art: Chris Kindred
Human Nature
It’s the year 3000 on Earth. There are no green spaces. The world has evolved to no longer need plants nor chooses to remember its natural past. We now live in an united nation of corporations in an artificial world, created to grant our every whims. Our language are barcodes. Yet humanity still has a subset of people who still yearn for the ways of the past. This story will focus on an unlikely individual who is fighting the status quo in her own way.
Art: Leigh Walls
Colors: Justin Wood
Attack of the Panic
Isn't it funny how the very thing that scares us the most, gives us strength? 
Art: David Degrand
Antique
After losing his spouse, Floyd gets a new lease on life, with the appearance of a reluctant genie. 
Art: JoJo Seames
Letters: Michael Neno
Mirror
People see lots of things, when Jamie walks by.
But are they seeing the real Jamie? 
Art: Meredith Laxton
Hero Worship
What if a Golden Age superhero was in an interracial marriage? Can he protect a city where his wife isn't viewed as human?
